title: Carol Kirkwood Announces Departure from BBC After Decades of Service
summary: Carol Kirkwood, a longtime weather presenter for BBC Breakfast, emotionally announced her departure from the BBC after over 25 years of service. During a broadcast, she fought back tears and hugged co-presenters Jon Kay and Sally Nugent, expressing that leaving was difficult because she loves her job. Kirkwood, who is 63 and joined the BBC in 1998, stated she will leave in April, calling it a privilege to deliver weather forecasts to viewers. Her decision is driven by a desire to spend more time with her husband, Steve Randall, whom she married in 2023, and to travel, as they often have busy schedules. Known for her friendly and trusted presence, Kirkwood has been a main weather presenter on BBC Breakfast since 2010, reaching millions daily. Her career includes presenting from notable locations like Wimbledon and the Chelsea Flower Show, reporting for The One Show, and competing on Strictly Come Dancing in 2015. She has received multiple awards for best TV weather presenter and occasionally gained attention for on-air mishaps. Kirkwood began her BBC career as a production secretary on BBC Breakfast, highlighting her long journey with the corporation.
